ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Insights into many ways to value and estimate value of Financial items. 
A broad understanding of the financial world and all the different aspects of it.

This class was one of the most directly useful classes I have ever taken at Yale. I went from knowing almost nothing about the world of finance to understanding different asset classes and how they are priced, how to build a portfolio and make investments, how to use derivatives when trading, and much more! The lectures covered a lot of material without making it overwhelming. The Portfolio Management assignment where we used a website to manage a portfolio taught me so much about the markets, portfolio composition, and report-writing.
Core concepts in financial theory and portfolio management
Gained introduction to financial concepts and applications
Essential financial modelling skills for an individual investor
Personal finance & practical finance knowledge
Learned about stocks, portfolio theory, fixed income securities, and derivatives, among other topics.
This class provided information very applicable to fixed income investing in practice.
The class teaches you how to analyze the returns of a portfolio and the basics of portfolio construction. It also teaches you bond pricing and the basics of how options work.
good
Loved this class.
finance

I now have a general idea about the various financial assets and a theoretical understanding of the financial market through the lens of different models. I have developed an understanding of the pricing of different assets and the associated trading strategies. I have applied such knowledge in my own experimental investment and begun to gain first-hand experience with engaging with the financial market.
An overview of financial markets, portfolio theory, asset pricing models, trading strategies, stocks, fixed income securities, and derivatives

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strength - very clearly laid out. Not much weakness.
Good lectures, good group tasks.

Strengths: Prof Matthies made a conscious effort to break down all the concepts and answer questions during lecture so that everyone could follow along. He was also always available to answer questions over email or to meet with students one-on-one to discuss questions on the material. The Portfolio Management assignment was a fantastic way to get real-life investing experience without any of the risk. It taught me so much about building a portfolio and also analyzing the returns/performance of that portfolio.
Weakness: Honestly, not much. I wish we had more time in the semester to cover some more aspects of financial economics. Also, maybe it might be useful to have a lecture on different types of portfolios and securities before the trading period starts for the Portfolio Management project. That's very minor.
Very interesting topics and it made me more interested in the area

Strengths - Interesting material to people interested in finance, wonderful professor
Weaknesses - TAs were not very responsive or helpful, course material could be better organized

With no formal training investment strategies I thought the course was a really good introduction to investment strategies for an individual investor. I feel as though the class has taught me a great deal and I'm sure it'll stick with me in the future
Very practical.
good
I think we could have had more direction on portfolio theory part of project. I wasnt really sure what to do half the time. But the topics were important and the professor taught them in a great way.
very good teaching

The course is very comprehensive in terms of introducing students to the financial market. Hence perhaps too much information is included in the course. In fact, the professor did not manage to finish everything he planned to teach us by the end of the semester. If the course is better structured (maybe a little bit less content, or maybe a more efficient teaching method, although this semester has been very productive already), this unfortunate issue might be avoided. Overall, I think the course is very good.
The flexibility of discussion section is a major bonus. For students with a tight schedule (five courses and an on-campus job, in my case), mandatory attendance in sections is impossible. The fact that I can attend sections whenever I needed to and my schedule allowed tremendously improved my experience.

Strengths: All of the topics we covered in class would be super useful for a career in finance. I thought that the projects were amazing experiences, one of which involved managing a simulated portfolio at real-time market prices and the other involving analyzing real financial data. I loved the professor and the course was well-organized - the lecture slides and practice problems + solutions were really helpful (as well as the optional textbook).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, you will really enjoy this course under Professor Ben's instruction if you are interested in finance/investments.
Yes, great introduction for finance.
Absolutely. One of the better Econ classes I have taken due to how applicable it is to real-life.

Yes! Take this class irrespective of your interest in pursuing a career in finance. Everyone  should understand the basics of the markets, securities, and portfolio theory. If you will have a Roth IRA or 401k in the future, this class can help you understand how to grow that money for retirement. If you're preparing for finance-role recruiting, this class is also phenomenal to get a good understanding of the markets and securities trading.
Yes, especially if you are interested in finance because it will give you an idea of what it is like
Yes if interested in finance, but it definitely helps if have had internship or relevant experience going into this course
Yes - Enjoyable class and engaging assignments without being an overbearing workload - very enjoyable
Yes!!

Yes!! This course is very interesting and I learned a lot about the basics of investing and financial models. Professor Matthies was always more than willing to assist with problems or questions and the structure of the course was just hard enough to learn but not too challenging to be discouraging.
Yes
If you are interested in finance or economics then yes.
Yes, if you are interested in investing.

Would recommend this course if you are interested in finance. If you've done a bit of work in finance already, this course will be a breeze. If you have a strong mathematical background, you will find this course a breeze. The topics are interesting, some real-world phenomena are brought up, we had a couple of guest speakers. Definitely worth taking if you want to learn more about financial markets.
froo
Yes
Yes. Any student who is interested in exploring the financial market should take this introductory course. It is an important academic stepping stone.
Yes!! What you learn in this course are so applicable if you want to pursue a career in finance (particularly asset management)!
